intro: Aphanamixis macrocalyx, commonly known as the giant hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture and a strong, aromatic scent. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and requires well-drained soil. Aphanamixis macrocalyx is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
